intro: Echites turbinatus, commonly known as the turbinated echites, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Echites turbinatus is often grown in gardens for its delicate appearance and can thrive in partial shade to full sun conditions.
